intro: Astracantha rumelica, commonly known as the Rumelian Astracantha, is a flowering plant native to parts of the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent. Astracantha rumelica is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
